abstract_summ: Vesicular skin rashes have been associated to the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID‐19), but there is little information about this cutaneous manifestation . Lesions may be classified as acral areas of erythema with vesicles or pustules (Pseudo‐chilblain) (19%), other vesicular eruptions (9%), urticarial lesions (19%) and maculopapular eruptions and livedo or necrosis (6%) Vesicular lesions appear early in the course of the disease (15% before other symptoms)
